intro: Verticordia etheliana, commonly known as the Ethel’s wand, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking, spire-like inflorescence composed of numerous small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathland environments. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
